text.p: These are the leading stories in the Maltese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Uncertainty on EU could harm investment, government says; Malta Federation of Industry urging government to clarify position on EU; Malta applied for membership in 1990 but new Labour government says it does not want Malta to join.
- Pakistani worker injured in cab of truck when stone blown away in explosion during rock-clearing at Malta Freeport smashed through windscreen and into his face.
- Police looking into last week's $1.3 million robbery from Group 4 security firm say employee told them attempts were made to rope him in as acocmplice two years ago.

- 41 candidates for elections on Thursday to fill seats in parliament vacated by candidates elected from two divisions in October 26 general elections. Candidates can represent only one division and therefore have to give up one.
